03906         String::CStringEquals(term, "cygwin");
03907     return stdout_is_tty && term_supports_color;
03908 #endif  // GTEST_OS_WINDOWS
03909   }
03910 
03911   return String::CaseInsensitiveCStringEquals(gtest_color, "yes") ||
03912       String::CaseInsensitiveCStringEquals(gtest_color, "true") ||
03913       String::CaseInsensitiveCStringEquals(gtest_color, "t") ||
03914       String::CStringEquals(gtest_color, "1");
03915   // We take "yes", "true", "t", and "1" as meaning "yes".  If the
03916   // value is neither one of these nor "auto", we treat it as "no" to
03917   // be conservative.
03918 }
03919 
03920 // Helpers for printing colored strings to stdout. Note that on Windows, we
03921 // cannot simply emit special characters and have the terminal change colors.
03922 // This routine must actually emit the characters rather than return a string
03923 // that would be colored when printed, as can be done on Linux.
03924 void ColoredPrintf(GTestColor color, const char* fmt, ...) {
03925   va_list args;
03926   va_start(args, fmt);
03927 
03928 #if GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE || GTEST_OS_SYMBIAN || GTEST_OS_ZOS
03929   const bool use_color = false;
03930 #else
03931   static const bool in_color_mode =
03932       ShouldUseColor(posix::IsATTY(posix::FileNo(stdout)) != 0);
03933   const bool use_color = in_color_mode && (color != COLOR_DEFAULT);
03934 #endif  // GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE || GTEST_OS_SYMBIAN || GTEST_OS_ZOS
03935   // The '!= 0' comparison is necessary to satisfy MSVC 7.1.
03936 
03937   if (!use_color) {
03938     vprintf(fmt, args);
03939     va_end(args);
03940     return;
03941   }
03942 
03943 #if GTEST_OS_WINDOWS && !GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE
03944   const HANDLE stdout_handle = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
03945 
03946   // Gets the current text color.
03947   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO buffer_info;
03948   GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(stdout_handle, &buffer_info);
03949   const WORD old_color_attrs = buffer_info.wAttributes;
03950 
03951   // We need to flush the stream buffers into the console before each
03952   // SetConsoleTextAttribute call lest it affect the text that is already
03953   // printed but has not yet reached the console.
03954   fflush(stdout);
03955   SetConsoleTextAttribute(stdout_handle,
03956                           GetColorAttribute(color) | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY);
03957   vprintf(fmt, args);
03958 
03959   fflush(stdout);
03960   // Restores the text color.
03961   SetConsoleTextAttribute(stdout_handle, old_color_attrs);
03962 #else
03963   printf("\033[0;3%sm", GetAnsiColorCode(color));
03964   vprintf(fmt, args);
03965   printf("\033[m");  // Resets the terminal to default.
03966 #endif  // GTEST_OS_WINDOWS && !GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE
03967   va_end(args);
03968 }
03969 
03970 void PrintFullTestCommentIfPresent(const TestInfo& test_info) {
03971   const char* const type_param = test_info.type_param();
03972   const char* const value_param = test_info.value_param();
03973 
03974   if (type_param != NULL || value_param != NULL) {
03975     printf(", where ");
03976     if (type_param != NULL) {
03977       printf("TypeParam = %s", type_param);
03978       if (value_param != NULL)
03979         printf(" and ");
03980     }
03981     if (value_param != NULL) {
03982       printf("GetParam() = %s", value_param);
03983     }
03984   }
03985 }
03986 
03987 // This class implements the TestEventListener interface.
03988 //
03989 // Class PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter is copyable.
03990 class PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter : public TestEventListener {
03991  public:
03992   PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter() {}
03993   static void PrintTestName(const char * test_case, const char * test) {
03994     printf("%s.%s", test_case, test);
03995   }
03996 
03997   // The following methods override what's in the TestEventListener class.
03998   virtual void OnTestProgramStart(const UnitTest& /*unit_test*/) {}
03999   virtual void OnTestIterationStart(const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration);
04000   virtual void OnEnvironmentsSetUpStart(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04001   virtual void OnEnvironmentsSetUpEnd(const UnitTest& /*unit_test*/) {}
04002   virtual void OnTestCaseStart(const TestCase& test_case);
04003   virtual void OnTestStart(const TestInfo& test_info);
04004   virtual void OnTestPartResult(const TestPartResult& result);
04005   virtual void OnTestEnd(const TestInfo& test_info);
04006   virtual void OnTestCaseEnd(const TestCase& test_case);
04007   virtual void OnEnvironmentsTearDownStart(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04008   virtual void OnEnvironmentsTearDownEnd(const UnitTest& /*unit_test*/) {}
04009   virtual void OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration);
04010   virtual void OnTestProgramEnd(const UnitTest& /*unit_test*/) {}
04011 
04012  private:
04013   static void PrintFailedTests(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04014 
04015   internal::String test_case_name_;
04016 };
04017 
04018   // Fired before each iteration of tests starts.
04019 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestIterationStart(
04020     const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration) {
04021   if (GTEST_FLAG(repeat) != 1)
04022     printf("\nRepeating all tests (iteration %d) . . .\n\n", iteration + 1);
04023 
04024   const char* const filter = GTEST_FLAG(filter).c_str();
04025 
04026   // Prints the filter if it's not *.  This reminds the user that some
04027   // tests may be skipped.
04028   if (!internal::String::CStringEquals(filter, kUniversalFilter)) {
04029     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_YELLOW,
04030                   "Note: %s filter = %s\n", GTEST_NAME_, filter);
04031   }
04032 
04033   if (internal::ShouldShard(kTestTotalShards, kTestShardIndex, false)) {
04034     const Int32 shard_index = Int32FromEnvOrDie(kTestShardIndex, -1);
04035     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_YELLOW,
04036                   "Note: This is test shard %d of %s.\n",
04037                   static_cast<int>(shard_index) + 1,
04038                   internal::posix::GetEnv(kTestTotalShards));
04039   }
04040 
04041   if (GTEST_FLAG(shuffle)) {
04042     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_YELLOW,
04043                   "Note: Randomizing tests' orders with a seed of %d .\n",
04044                   unit_test.random_seed());
04045   }
04046 
04047   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN,  "[==========] ");
04048   printf("Running %s from %s.\n",
04049          FormatTestCount(unit_test.test_to_run_count()).c_str(),
04050          FormatTestCaseCount(unit_test.test_case_to_run_count()).c_str());
04051   fflush(stdout);
04052 }
04053 
04054 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnEnvironmentsSetUpStart(
04055     const UnitTest& /*unit_test*/) {
04056   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN,  "[----------] ");
04057   printf("Global test environment set-up.\n");
04058   fflush(stdout);
04059 }
04060 
04061 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestCaseStart(const TestCase& test_case) {
04062   test_case_name_ = test_case.name();
04063   const internal::String counts =
04064       FormatCountableNoun(test_case.test_to_run_count(), "test", "tests");
04065   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN, "[----------] ");
04066   printf("%s from %s", counts.c_str(), test_case_name_.c_str());
04067   if (test_case.type_param() == NULL) {
04068     printf("\n");
04069   } else {
04070     printf(", where TypeParam = %s\n", test_case.type_param());
04071   }
04072   fflush(stdout);
04073 }
04074 
04075 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestStart(const TestInfo& test_info) {
04076   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN,  "[ RUN      ] ");
04077   PrintTestName(test_case_name_.c_str(), test_info.name());
04078   printf("\n");
04079   fflush(stdout);
04080 }
04081 
04082 // Called after an assertion failure.
04083 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestPartResult(
04084     const TestPartResult& result) {
04085   // If the test part succeeded, we don't need to do anything.
04086   if (result.type() == TestPartResult::kSuccess)
04087     return;
04088 
04089   // Print failure message from the assertion (e.g. expected this and got that).
04090   PrintTestPartResult(result);
04091   fflush(stdout);
04092 }
04093 
04094 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestEnd(const TestInfo& test_info) {
04095   if (test_info.result()->Passed()) {
04096     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN, "[       OK ] ");
04097   } else {
04098     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_RED, "[  FAILED  ] ");
04099   }
04100   PrintTestName(test_case_name_.c_str(), test_info.name());
04101   if (test_info.result()->Failed())
04102     PrintFullTestCommentIfPresent(test_info);
04103 
04104   if (GTEST_FLAG(print_time)) {
04105     printf(" (%s ms)\n", internal::StreamableToString(
04106            test_info.result()->elapsed_time()).c_str());
04107   } else {
04108     printf("\n");
04109   }
04110   fflush(stdout);
04111 }
04112 
04113 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestCaseEnd(const TestCase& test_case) {
04114   if (!GTEST_FLAG(print_time)) return;
04115 
04116   test_case_name_ = test_case.name();
04117   const internal::String counts =
04118       FormatCountableNoun(test_case.test_to_run_count(), "test", "tests");
04119   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN, "[----------] ");
04120   printf("%s from %s (%s ms total)\n\n",
04121          counts.c_str(), test_case_name_.c_str(),
04122          internal::StreamableToString(test_case.elapsed_time()).c_str());
04123   fflush(stdout);
04124 }
04125 
04126 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnEnvironmentsTearDownStart(
04127     const UnitTest& /*unit_test*/) {
04128   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN,  "[----------] ");
04129   printf("Global test environment tear-down\n");
04130   fflush(stdout);
04131 }
04132 
04133 // Internal helper for printing the list of failed tests.
04134 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::PrintFailedTests(const UnitTest& unit_test) {
04135   const int failed_test_count = unit_test.failed_test_count();
04136   if (failed_test_count == 0) {
04137     return;
04138   }
04139 
04140   for (int i = 0; i < unit_test.total_test_case_count(); ++i) {
04141     const TestCase& test_case = *unit_test.GetTestCase(i);
04142     if (!test_case.should_run() || (test_case.failed_test_count() == 0)) {
04143       continue;
04144     }
04145     for (int j = 0; j < test_case.total_test_count(); ++j) {
04146       const TestInfo& test_info = *test_case.GetTestInfo(j);
04147       if (!test_info.should_run() || test_info.result()->Passed()) {
04148         continue;
04149       }
04150       ColoredPrintf(COLOR_RED, "[  FAILED  ] ");
04151       printf("%s.%s", test_case.name(), test_info.name());
04152       PrintFullTestCommentIfPresent(test_info);
04153       printf("\n");
04154     }
04155   }
04156 }
04157 
04158 void PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test,
04159                                                      int /*iteration*/) {
04160   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN,  "[==========] ");
04161   printf("%s from %s ran.",
04162          FormatTestCount(unit_test.test_to_run_count()).c_str(),
04163          FormatTestCaseCount(unit_test.test_case_to_run_count()).c_str());
04164   if (GTEST_FLAG(print_time)) {
04165     printf(" (%s ms total)",
04166            internal::StreamableToString(unit_test.elapsed_time()).c_str());
04167   }
04168   printf("\n");
04169   ColoredPrintf(COLOR_GREEN,  "[  PASSED  ] ");
04170   printf("%s.\n", FormatTestCount(unit_test.successful_test_count()).c_str());
04171 
04172   int num_failures = unit_test.failed_test_count();
04173   if (!unit_test.Passed()) {
04174     const int failed_test_count = unit_test.failed_test_count();
04175     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_RED,  "[  FAILED  ] ");
04176     printf("%s, listed below:\n", FormatTestCount(failed_test_count).c_str());
04177     PrintFailedTests(unit_test);
04178     printf("\n%2d FAILED %s\n", num_failures,
04179                         num_failures == 1 ? "TEST" : "TESTS");
04180   }
04181 
04182   int num_disabled = unit_test.disabled_test_count();
04183   if (num_disabled && !GTEST_FLAG(also_run_disabled_tests)) {
04184     if (!num_failures) {
04185       printf("\n");  // Add a spacer if no FAILURE banner is displayed.
04186     }
04187     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_YELLOW,
04188                   "  YOU HAVE %d DISABLED %s\n\n",
04189                   num_disabled,
04190                   num_disabled == 1 ? "TEST" : "TESTS");
04191   }
04192   // Ensure that Google Test output is printed before, e.g., heapchecker output.
04193   fflush(stdout);
04194 }
04195 
04196 // End PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter
04197 
04198 // class TestEventRepeater
04199 //
04200 // This class forwards events to other event listeners.
04201 class TestEventRepeater : public TestEventListener {
04202  public:
04203   TestEventRepeater() : forwarding_enabled_(true) {}
04204   virtual ~TestEventRepeater();
04205   void Append(TestEventListener *listener);
04206   TestEventListener* Release(TestEventListener* listener);
04207 
04208   // Controls whether events will be forwarded to listeners_. Set to false
04209   // in death test child processes.
04210   bool forwarding_enabled() const { return forwarding_enabled_; }
04211   void set_forwarding_enabled(bool enable) { forwarding_enabled_ = enable; }
04212 
04213   virtual void OnTestProgramStart(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04214   virtual void OnTestIterationStart(const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration);
04215   virtual void OnEnvironmentsSetUpStart(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04216   virtual void OnEnvironmentsSetUpEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04217   virtual void OnTestCaseStart(const TestCase& test_case);
04218   virtual void OnTestStart(const TestInfo& test_info);
04219   virtual void OnTestPartResult(const TestPartResult& result);
04220   virtual void OnTestEnd(const TestInfo& test_info);
04221   virtual void OnTestCaseEnd(const TestCase& test_case);
04222   virtual void OnEnvironmentsTearDownStart(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04223   virtual void OnEnvironmentsTearDownEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04224   virtual void OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration);
04225   virtual void OnTestProgramEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test);
04226 
04227  private:
04228   // Controls whether events will be forwarded to listeners_. Set to false
04229   // in death test child processes.
04230   bool forwarding_enabled_;
04231   // The list of listeners that receive events.
04232   std::vector<TestEventListener*> listeners_;
04233 
04234   GTEST_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN_(TestEventRepeater);
04235 };
04236 
04237 TestEventRepeater::~TestEventRepeater() {
04238   ForEach(listeners_, Delete<TestEventListener>);
04239 }
04240 
04241 void TestEventRepeater::Append(TestEventListener *listener) {
04242   listeners_.push_back(listener);
04243 }
04244 
04245 // TODO(vladl@google.com): Factor the search functionality into Vector::Find.
04246 TestEventListener* TestEventRepeater::Release(TestEventListener *listener) {
04247   for (size_t i = 0; i < listeners_.size(); ++i) {
04248     if (listeners_[i] == listener) {
04249       listeners_.erase(listeners_.begin() + i);
04250       return listener;
04251     }
04252   }
04253 
04254   return NULL;
04255 }
04256 
04257 // Since most methods are very similar, use macros to reduce boilerplate.
04258 // This defines a member that forwards the call to all listeners.
04259 #define GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_(Name, Type) \
04260 void TestEventRepeater::Name(const Type& parameter) { \
04261   if (forwarding_enabled_) { \
04262     for (size_t i = 0; i < listeners_.size(); i++) { \
04263       listeners_[i]->Name(parameter); \
04264     } \
04265   } \
04266 }
04267 // This defines a member that forwards the call to all listeners in reverse
04268 // order.
04269 #define GTEST_REVERSE_REPEATER_METHOD_(Name, Type) \
04270 void TestEventRepeater::Name(const Type& parameter) { \
04271   if (forwarding_enabled_) { \
04272     for (int i = static_cast<int>(listeners_.size()) - 1; i >= 0; i--) { \
04273       listeners_[i]->Name(parameter); \
04274     } \
04275   } \
04276 }
04277 
04278 GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnTestProgramStart, UnitTest)
04279 GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnEnvironmentsSetUpStart, UnitTest)
04280 GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnTestCaseStart, TestCase)
04281 GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnTestStart, TestInfo)
04282 GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnTestPartResult, TestPartResult)
04283 GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnEnvironmentsTearDownStart, UnitTest)
04284 GTEST_REVERSE_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnEnvironmentsSetUpEnd, UnitTest)
04285 GTEST_REVERSE_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnEnvironmentsTearDownEnd, UnitTest)
04286 GTEST_REVERSE_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnTestEnd, TestInfo)
04287 GTEST_REVERSE_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnTestCaseEnd, TestCase)
04288 GTEST_REVERSE_REPEATER_METHOD_(OnTestProgramEnd, UnitTest)
04289 
04290 #undef GTEST_REPEATER_METHOD_
04291 #undef GTEST_REVERSE_REPEATER_METHOD_
04292 
04293 void TestEventRepeater::OnTestIterationStart(const UnitTest& unit_test,
04294                                              int iteration) {
04295   if (forwarding_enabled_) {
04296     for (size_t i = 0; i < listeners_.size(); i++) {
04297       listeners_[i]->OnTestIterationStart(unit_test, iteration);
04298     }
04299   }
04300 }
04301 
04302 void TestEventRepeater::OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test,
04303                                            int iteration) {
04304   if (forwarding_enabled_) {
04305     for (int i = static_cast<int>(listeners_.size()) - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
04306       listeners_[i]->OnTestIterationEnd(unit_test, iteration);
04307     }
04308   }
04309 }
04310 
04311 // End TestEventRepeater
04312 
04313 // This class generates an XML output file.
04314 class XmlUnitTestResultPrinter : public EmptyTestEventListener {
04315  public:
04316   explicit XmlUnitTestResultPrinter(const char* output_file);
04317 
04318   virtual void OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration);
04319 
04320  private:
04321   // Is c a whitespace character that is normalized to a space character
04322   // when it appears in an XML attribute value?
04323   static bool IsNormalizableWhitespace(char c) {
04324     return c == 0x9 || c == 0xA || c == 0xD;
04325   }
04326 
04327   // May c appear in a well-formed XML document?
04328   static bool IsValidXmlCharacter(char c) {
04329     return IsNormalizableWhitespace(c) || c >= 0x20;
04330   }
04331 
04332   // Returns an XML-escaped copy of the input string str.  If
04333   // is_attribute is true, the text is meant to appear as an attribute
04334   // value, and normalizable whitespace is preserved by replacing it
04335   // with character references.
04336   static String EscapeXml(const char* str, bool is_attribute);
04337 
04338   // Returns the given string with all characters invalid in XML removed.
04339   static string RemoveInvalidXmlCharacters(const string& str);
04340 
04341   // Convenience wrapper around EscapeXml when str is an attribute value.
04342   static String EscapeXmlAttribute(const char* str) {
04343     return EscapeXml(str, true);
04344   }
04345 
04346   // Convenience wrapper around EscapeXml when str is not an attribute value.
04347   static String EscapeXmlText(const char* str) { return EscapeXml(str, false); }
04348 
04349   // Streams an XML CDATA section, escaping invalid CDATA sequences as needed.
04350   static void OutputXmlCDataSection(::std::ostream* stream, const char* data);
04351 
04352   // Streams an XML representation of a TestInfo object.
04353   static void OutputXmlTestInfo(::std::ostream* stream,
04354                                 const char* test_case_name,
04355                                 const TestInfo& test_info);
04356 
04357   // Prints an XML representation of a TestCase object
04358   static void PrintXmlTestCase(FILE* out, const TestCase& test_case);
04359 
04360   // Prints an XML summary of unit_test to output stream out.
04361   static void PrintXmlUnitTest(FILE* out, const UnitTest& unit_test);
04362 
04363   // Produces a string representing the test properties in a result as space
04364   // delimited XML attributes based on the property key="value" pairs.
04365   // When the String is not empty, it includes a space at the beginning,
04366   // to delimit this attribute from prior attributes.
04367   static String TestPropertiesAsXmlAttributes(const TestResult& result);
04368 
04369   // The output file.
04370   const String output_file_;
04371 
04372   GTEST_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN_(XmlUnitTestResultPrinter);
04373 };
04374 
04375 // Creates a new XmlUnitTestResultPrinter.
04376 XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::XmlUnitTestResultPrinter(const char* output_file)
04377     : output_file_(output_file) {
04378   if (output_file_.c_str() == NULL || output_file_.empty()) {
04379     fprintf(stderr, "XML output file may not be null\n");
04380     fflush(stderr);
04381     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
04382   }
04383 }
04384 
04385 // Called after the unit test ends.
04386 void XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test,
04387                                                   int /*iteration*/) {
04388   FILE* xmlout = NULL;
04389   FilePath output_file(output_file_);
04390   FilePath output_dir(output_file.RemoveFileName());
04391 
04392   if (output_dir.CreateDirectoriesRecursively()) {
04393     xmlout = posix::FOpen(output_file_.c_str(), "w");
04394   }
04395   if (xmlout == NULL) {
04396     // TODO(wan): report the reason of the failure.
04397     //
04398     // We don't do it for now as:
04399     //
04400     //   1. There is no urgent need for it.
04401     //   2. It's a bit involved to make the errno variable thread-safe on
04402     //      all three operating systems (Linux, Windows, and Mac OS).
04403     //   3. To interpret the meaning of errno in a thread-safe way,
04404     //      we need the strerror_r() function, which is not available on
04405     //      Windows.
04406     fprintf(stderr,
04407             "Unable to open file \"%s\"\n",
04408             output_file_.c_str());
04409     fflush(stderr);
04410     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
04411   }
04412   PrintXmlUnitTest(xmlout, unit_test);
04413   fclose(xmlout);
04414 }
04415 
04416 // Returns an XML-escaped copy of the input string str.  If is_attribute
04417 // is true, the text is meant to appear as an attribute value, and
04418 // normalizable whitespace is preserved by replacing it with character
04419 // references.
04420 //
04421 // Invalid XML characters in str, if any, are stripped from the output.
04422 // It is expected that most, if not all, of the text processed by this
04423 // module will consist of ordinary English text.
04424 // If this module is ever modified to produce version 1.1 XML output,
04425 // most invalid characters can be retained using character references.
04426 // TODO(wan): It might be nice to have a minimally invasive, human-readable
04427 // escaping scheme for invalid characters, rather than dropping them.
04428 String XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::EscapeXml(const char* str, bool is_attribute) {
04429   Message m;
04430 
04431   if (str != NULL) {
04432     for (const char* src = str; *src; ++src) {
04433       switch (*src) {
04434         case '<':
04435           m << "&lt;";
04436           break;
04437         case '>':
04438           m << "&gt;";
04439           break;
04440         case '&':
04441           m << "&amp;";
04442           break;
04443         case '\'':
04444           if (is_attribute)
04445             m << "&apos;";
04446           else
04447             m << '\'';
04448           break;
04449         case '"':
04450           if (is_attribute)
04451             m << "&quot;";
04452           else
04453             m << '"';
04454           break;
04455         default:
04456           if (IsValidXmlCharacter(*src)) {
04457             if (is_attribute && IsNormalizableWhitespace(*src))
04458               m << String::Format("&#x%02X;", unsigned(*src));
04459             else
04460               m << *src;
04461           }
04462           break;
04463       }
04464     }
04465   }
04466 
04467   return m.GetString();
04468 }
04469 
04470 // Returns the given string with all characters invalid in XML removed.
04471 // Currently invalid characters are dropped from the string. An
04472 // alternative is to replace them with certain characters such as . or ?.
04473 string XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::RemoveInvalidXmlCharacters(const string& str) {
04474   string output;
04475   output.reserve(str.size());
04476   for (string::const_iterator it = str.begin(); it != str.end(); ++it)
04477     if (IsValidXmlCharacter(*it))
04478       output.push_back(*it);
04479 
04480   return output;
04481 }
04482 
04483 // The following routines generate an XML representation of a UnitTest
04484 // object.
04485 //
04486 // This is how Google Test concepts map to the DTD:
04487 //
04488 // <testsuites name="AllTests">        <-- corresponds to a UnitTest object
04489 //   <testsuite name="testcase-name">  <-- corresponds to a TestCase object
04490 //     <testcase name="test-name">     <-- corresponds to a TestInfo object
04491 //       <failure message="...">...</failure>
04492 //       <failure message="...">...</failure>
04493 //       <failure message="...">...</failure>
04494 //                                     <-- individual assertion failures
04495 //     </testcase>
04496 //   </testsuite>
04497 // </testsuites>
04498 
04499 // Formats the given time in milliseconds as seconds.
04500 std::string FormatTimeInMillisAsSeconds(TimeInMillis ms) {
04501   ::std::stringstream ss;
04502   ss << ms/1000.0;
04503   return ss.str();
04504 }
04505 
04506 // Streams an XML CDATA section, escaping invalid CDATA sequences as needed.
04507 void XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::OutputXmlCDataSection(::std::ostream* stream,
04508                                                      const char* data) {
04509   const char* segment = data;
04510   *stream << "<![CDATA[";
04511   for (;;) {
04512     const char* const next_segment = strstr(segment, "]]>");
04513     if (next_segment != NULL) {
04514       stream->write(
04515           segment, static_cast<std::streamsize>(next_segment - segment));
04516       *stream << "]]>]]&gt;<![CDATA[";
04517       segment = next_segment + strlen("]]>");
04518     } else {
04519       *stream << segment;
04520       break;
04521     }
04522   }
04523   *stream << "]]>";
04524 }
04525 
04526 // Prints an XML representation of a TestInfo object.
04527 // TODO(wan): There is also value in printing properties with the plain printer.
04528 void XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::OutputXmlTestInfo(::std::ostream* stream,
04529                                                  const char* test_case_name,
04530                                                  const TestInfo& test_info) {
04531   const TestResult& result = *test_info.result();
04532   *stream << "    <testcase name=\""
04533           << EscapeXmlAttribute(test_info.name()).c_str() << "\"";
04534 
04535   if (test_info.value_param() != NULL) {
04536     *stream << " value_param=\"" << EscapeXmlAttribute(test_info.value_param())
04537             << "\"";
04538   }
04539   if (test_info.type_param() != NULL) {
04540     *stream << " type_param=\"" << EscapeXmlAttribute(test_info.type_param())
04541             << "\"";
04542   }
04543 
04544   *stream << " status=\""
04545           << (test_info.should_run() ? "run" : "notrun")
04546           << "\" time=\""
04547           << FormatTimeInMillisAsSeconds(result.elapsed_time())
04548           << "\" classname=\"" << EscapeXmlAttribute(test_case_name).c_str()
04549           << "\"" << TestPropertiesAsXmlAttributes(result).c_str();
04550 
04551   int failures = 0;
04552   for (int i = 0; i < result.total_part_count(); ++i) {
04553     const TestPartResult& part = result.GetTestPartResult(i);
04554     if (part.failed()) {
04555       if (++failures == 1)
04556         *stream << ">\n";
04557       *stream << "      <failure message=\""
04558               << EscapeXmlAttribute(part.summary()).c_str()
04559               << "\" type=\"\">";
04560       const string location = internal::FormatCompilerIndependentFileLocation(
04561           part.file_name(), part.line_number());
04562       const string message = location + "\n" + part.message();
04563       OutputXmlCDataSection(stream,
04564                             RemoveInvalidXmlCharacters(message).c_str());
04565       *stream << "</failure>\n";
04566     }
04567   }
04568 
04569   if (failures == 0)
04570     *stream << " />\n";
04571   else
04572     *stream << "    </testcase>\n";
04573 }
04574 
04575 // Prints an XML representation of a TestCase object
04576 void XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::PrintXmlTestCase(FILE* out,
04577                                                 const TestCase& test_case) {
04578   fprintf(out,
04579           "  <testsuite name=\"%s\" tests=\"%d\" failures=\"%d\" "
04580           "disabled=\"%d\" ",
04581           EscapeXmlAttribute(test_case.name()).c_str(),
04582           test_case.total_test_count(),
04583           test_case.failed_test_count(),
04584           test_case.disabled_test_count());
04585   fprintf(out,
04586           "errors=\"0\" time=\"%s\">\n",
04587           FormatTimeInMillisAsSeconds(test_case.elapsed_time()).c_str());
04588   for (int i = 0; i < test_case.total_test_count(); ++i) {
04589     ::std::stringstream stream;
04590     OutputXmlTestInfo(&stream, test_case.name(), *test_case.GetTestInfo(i));
04591     fprintf(out, "%s", StringStreamToString(&stream).c_str());
04592   }
04593   fprintf(out, "  </testsuite>\n");
04594 }
04595 
04596 // Prints an XML summary of unit_test to output stream out.
04597 void XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::PrintXmlUnitTest(FILE* out,
04598                                                 const UnitTest& unit_test) {
04599   fprintf(out, "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n");
04600   fprintf(out,
04601           "<testsuites tests=\"%d\" failures=\"%d\" disabled=\"%d\" "
04602           "errors=\"0\" time=\"%s\" ",
04603           unit_test.total_test_count(),
04604           unit_test.failed_test_count(),
04605           unit_test.disabled_test_count(),
04606           FormatTimeInMillisAsSeconds(unit_test.elapsed_time()).c_str());
04607   if (GTEST_FLAG(shuffle)) {
04608     fprintf(out, "random_seed=\"%d\" ", unit_test.random_seed());
04609   }
04610   fprintf(out, "name=\"AllTests\">\n");
04611   for (int i = 0; i < unit_test.total_test_case_count(); ++i)
04612     PrintXmlTestCase(out, *unit_test.GetTestCase(i));
04613   fprintf(out, "</testsuites>\n");
04614 }
04615 
04616 // Produces a string representing the test properties in a result as space
04617 // delimited XML attributes based on the property key="value" pairs.
04618 String XmlUnitTestResultPrinter::TestPropertiesAsXmlAttributes(
04619     const TestResult& result) {
04620   Message attributes;
04621   for (int i = 0; i < result.test_property_count(); ++i) {
04622     const TestProperty& property = result.GetTestProperty(i);
04623     attributes << " " << property.key() << "="
04624         << "\"" << EscapeXmlAttribute(property.value()) << "\"";
04625   }
04626   return attributes.GetString();
04627 }
04628 
04629 // End XmlUnitTestResultPrinter
04630 
04631 #if GTEST_CAN_STREAM_RESULTS_
04632 
04633 // Streams test results to the given port on the given host machine.
04634 class StreamingListener : public EmptyTestEventListener {
04635  public:
04636   // Escapes '=', '&', '%', and '\n' characters in str as "%xx".
04637   static string UrlEncode(const char* str);
04638 
04639   StreamingListener(const string& host, const string& port)
04640       : sockfd_(-1), host_name_(host), port_num_(port) {
04641     MakeConnection();
04642     Send("gtest_streaming_protocol_version=1.0\n");
04643   }
04644 
04645   virtual ~StreamingListener() {
04646     if (sockfd_ != -1)
04647       CloseConnection();
04648   }
04649 
04650   void OnTestProgramStart(const UnitTest& /* unit_test */) {
04651     Send("event=TestProgramStart\n");
04652   }
04653 
04654   void OnTestProgramEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test) {
04655     // Note that Google Test current only report elapsed time for each
04656     // test iteration, not for the entire test program.
04657     Send(String::Format("event=TestProgramEnd&passed=%d\n",
04658                         unit_test.Passed()));
04659 
04660     // Notify the streaming server to stop.
04661     CloseConnection();
04662   }
04663 
04664   void OnTestIterationStart(const UnitTest& /* unit_test */, int iteration) {
04665     Send(String::Format("event=TestIterationStart&iteration=%d\n",
04666                         iteration));
04667   }
04668 
04669   void OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test, int /* iteration */) {
04670     Send(String::Format("event=TestIterationEnd&passed=%d&elapsed_time=%sms\n",
04671                         unit_test.Passed(),
04672                         StreamableToString(unit_test.elapsed_time()).c_str()));
04673   }
04674 
04675   void OnTestCaseStart(const TestCase& test_case) {
04676     Send(String::Format("event=TestCaseStart&name=%s\n", test_case.name()));
04677   }
04678 
04679   void OnTestCaseEnd(const TestCase& test_case) {
04680     Send(String::Format("event=TestCaseEnd&passed=%d&elapsed_time=%sms\n",
04681                         test_case.Passed(),
04682                         StreamableToString(test_case.elapsed_time()).c_str()));
04683   }
04684 
04685   void OnTestStart(const TestInfo& test_info) {
04686     Send(String::Format("event=TestStart&name=%s\n", test_info.name()));
04687   }
04688 
04689   void OnTestEnd(const TestInfo& test_info) {
04690     Send(String::Format(
04691         "event=TestEnd&passed=%d&elapsed_time=%sms\n",
04692         (test_info.result())->Passed(),
04693         StreamableToString((test_info.result())->elapsed_time()).c_str()));
04694   }
04695 
04696   void OnTestPartResult(const TestPartResult& test_part_result) {
04697     const char* file_name = test_part_result.file_name();
04698     if (file_name == NULL)
04699       file_name = "";
04700     Send(String::Format("event=TestPartResult&file=%s&line=%d&message=",
04701                         UrlEncode(file_name).c_str(),
04702                         test_part_result.line_number()));
04703     Send(UrlEncode(test_part_result.message()) + "\n");
04704   }
04705 
04706  private:
04707   // Creates a client socket and connects to the server.
04708   void MakeConnection();
04709 
04710   // Closes the socket.
04711   void CloseConnection() {
04712     GTEST_CHECK_(sockfd_ != -1)
04713         << "CloseConnection() can be called only when there is a connection.";
04714 
04715     close(sockfd_);
04716     sockfd_ = -1;
04717   }
04718 
04719   // Sends a string to the socket.
04720   void Send(const string& message) {
04721     GTEST_CHECK_(sockfd_ != -1)
04722         << "Send() can be called only when there is a connection.";
04723 
04724     const int len = static_cast<int>(message.length());
04725     if (write(sockfd_, message.c_str(), len) != len) {
04726       GTEST_LOG_(WARNING)
04727           << "stream_result_to: failed to stream to "
04728           << host_name_ << ":" << port_num_;
04729     }
04730   }
04731 
04732   int sockfd_;   // socket file descriptor
04733   const string host_name_;
04734   const string port_num_;
04735 
04736   GTEST_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN_(StreamingListener);
04737 };  // class StreamingListener
04738 
04739 // Checks if str contains '=', '&', '%' or '\n' characters. If yes,
04740 // replaces them by "%xx" where xx is their hexadecimal value. For
04741 // example, replaces "=" with "%3D".  This algorithm is O(strlen(str))
04742 // in both time and space -- important as the input str may contain an
04743 // arbitrarily long test failure message and stack trace.
04744 string StreamingListener::UrlEncode(const char* str) {
04745   string result;
04746   result.reserve(strlen(str) + 1);
04747   for (char ch = *str; ch != '\0'; ch = *++str) {
04748     switch (ch) {
04749       case '%':
04750       case '=':
04751       case '&':
04752       case '\n':
04753         result.append(String::Format("%%%02x", static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)));
04754         break;
04755       default:
04756         result.push_back(ch);
04757         break;
04758     }
04759   }
04760   return result;
04761 }
04762 
04763 void StreamingListener::MakeConnection() {
04764   GTEST_CHECK_(sockfd_ == -1)
04765       << "MakeConnection() can't be called when there is already a connection.";
04766 
04767   addrinfo hints;
04768   memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
04769   hints.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC;    // To allow both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
04770   hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
04771   addrinfo* servinfo = NULL;
04772 
04773   // Use the getaddrinfo() to get a linked list of IP addresses for
04774   // the given host name.
04775   const int error_num = getaddrinfo(
04776       host_name_.c_str(), port_num_.c_str(), &hints, &servinfo);
04777   if (error_num != 0) {
04778     GTEST_LOG_(WARNING) << "stream_result_to: getaddrinfo() failed: "
04779                         << gai_strerror(error_num);
04780   }
04781 
04782   // Loop through all the results and connect to the first we can.
04783   for (addrinfo* cur_addr = servinfo; sockfd_ == -1 && cur_addr != NULL;
04784        cur_addr = cur_addr->ai_next) {
04785     sockfd_ = socket(
04786         cur_addr->ai_family, cur_addr->ai_socktype, cur_addr->ai_protocol);
04787     if (sockfd_ != -1) {
04788       // Connect the client socket to the server socket.
04789       if (connect(sockfd_, cur_addr->ai_addr, cur_addr->ai_addrlen) == -1) {
04790         close(sockfd_);
04791         sockfd_ = -1;
04792       }
04793     }
04794   }
04795 
04796   freeaddrinfo(servinfo);  // all done with this structure
04797 
04798   if (sockfd_ == -1) {
04799     GTEST_LOG_(WARNING) << "stream_result_to: failed to connect to "
04800                         << host_name_ << ":" << port_num_;
04801   }
04802 }
04803 
04804 // End of class Streaming Listener
04805 #endif  // GTEST_CAN_STREAM_RESULTS__
04806 
04807 // Class ScopedTrace
04808 
04809 // Pushes the given source file location and message onto a per-thread
04810 // trace stack maintained by Google Test.
04811 // L < UnitTest::mutex_
04812 ScopedTrace::ScopedTrace(const char* file, int line, const Message& message) {
04813   TraceInfo trace;
04814   trace.file = file;
04815   trace.line = line;
04816   trace.message = message.GetString();
04817 
04818   UnitTest::GetInstance()->PushGTestTrace(trace);
04819 }
04820 
04821 // Pops the info pushed by the c'tor.
04822 // L < UnitTest::mutex_
04823 ScopedTrace::~ScopedTrace() {
04824   UnitTest::GetInstance()->PopGTestTrace();
04825 }
04826 
04827 
04828 // class OsStackTraceGetter
04829 
04830 // Returns the current OS stack trace as a String.  Parameters:
04831 //
04832 //   max_depth  - the maximum number of stack frames to be included
04833 //                in the trace.
04834 //   skip_count - the number of top frames to be skipped; doesn't count
04835 //                against max_depth.
04836 //
04837 // L < mutex_
04838 // We use "L < mutex_" to denote that the function may acquire mutex_.
04839 String OsStackTraceGetter::CurrentStackTrace(int, int) {
04840   return String("");
04841 }
04842 
04843 // L < mutex_
04844 void OsStackTraceGetter::UponLeavingGTest() {
04845 }
04846 
04847 const char* const
04848 OsStackTraceGetter::kElidedFramesMarker =
04849     "... " GTEST_NAME_ " internal frames ...";
04850 
04851 }  // namespace internal
04852 
04853 // class TestEventListeners
04854 
04855 TestEventListeners::TestEventListeners()
04856     : repeater_(new internal::TestEventRepeater()),
04857       default_result_printer_(NULL),
04858       default_xml_generator_(NULL) {
04859 }
04860 
04861 TestEventListeners::~TestEventListeners() { delete repeater_; }
04862 
04863 // Returns the standard listener responsible for the default console
04864 // output.  Can be removed from the listeners list to shut down default
04865 // console output.  Note that removing this object from the listener list
04866 // with Release transfers its ownership to the user.
04867 void TestEventListeners::Append(TestEventListener* listener) {
04868   repeater_->Append(listener);
04869 }
04870 
04871 // Removes the given event listener from the list and returns it.  It then
04872 // becomes the caller's responsibility to delete the listener. Returns
04873 // NULL if the listener is not found in the list.
04874 TestEventListener* TestEventListeners::Release(TestEventListener* listener) {
04875   if (listener == default_result_printer_)
04876     default_result_printer_ = NULL;
04877   else if (listener == default_xml_generator_)
04878     default_xml_generator_ = NULL;
04879   return repeater_->Release(listener);
04880 }
04881 
04882 // Returns repeater that broadcasts the TestEventListener events to all
04883 // subscribers.
04884 TestEventListener* TestEventListeners::repeater() { return repeater_; }
04885 
04886 // Sets the default_result_printer attribute to the provided listener.
04887 // The listener is also added to the listener list and previous
04888 // default_result_printer is removed from it and deleted. The listener can
04889 // also be NULL in which case it will not be added to the list. Does
04890 // nothing if the previous and the current listener objects are the same.
04891 void TestEventListeners::SetDefaultResultPrinter(TestEventListener* listener) {
04892   if (default_result_printer_ != listener) {
04893     // It is an error to pass this method a listener that is already in the
04894     // list.
04895     delete Release(default_result_printer_);
04896     default_result_printer_ = listener;
04897     if (listener != NULL)
04898       Append(listener);
04899   }
04900 }
04901 
04902 // Sets the default_xml_generator attribute to the provided listener.  The
04903 // listener is also added to the listener list and previous
04904 // default_xml_generator is removed from it and deleted. The listener can
04905 // also be NULL in which case it will not be added to the list. Does
04906 // nothing if the previous and the current listener objects are the same.
04907 void TestEventListeners::SetDefaultXmlGenerator(TestEventListener* listener) {
04908   if (default_xml_generator_ != listener) {
04909     // It is an error to pass this method a listener that is already in the
04910     // list.
04911     delete Release(default_xml_generator_);
04912     default_xml_generator_ = listener;
04913     if (listener != NULL)
04914       Append(listener);
04915   }
04916 }
04917 
04918 // Controls whether events will be forwarded by the repeater to the
04919 // listeners in the list.
04920 bool TestEventListeners::EventForwardingEnabled() const {
04921   return repeater_->forwarding_enabled();
04922 }
04923 
04924 void TestEventListeners::SuppressEventForwarding() {
04925   repeater_->set_forwarding_enabled(false);
04926 }
04927 
04928 // class UnitTest
04929 
04930 // Gets the singleton UnitTest object.  The first time this method is
04931 // called, a UnitTest object is constructed and returned.  Consecutive
04932 // calls will return the same object.
04933 //
04934 // We don't protect this under mutex_ as a user is not supposed to
04935 // call this before main() starts, from which point on the return
04936 // value will never change.
04937 UnitTest * UnitTest::GetInstance() {
04938   // When compiled with MSVC 7.1 in optimized mode, destroying the
04939   // UnitTest object upon exiting the program messes up the exit code,
04940   // causing successful tests to appear failed.  We have to use a
04941   // different implementation in this case to bypass the compiler bug.
04942   // This implementation makes the compiler happy, at the cost of
04943   // leaking the UnitTest object.
04944 
04945   // CodeGear C++Builder insists on a public destructor for the
04946   // default implementation.  Use this implementation to keep good OO
04947   // design with private destructor.
04948 
04949 #if (_MSC_VER == 1310 && !defined(_DEBUG)) || defined(__BORLANDC__)
04950   static UnitTest* const instance = new UnitTest;
04951   return instance;
04952 #else
04953   static UnitTest instance;
04954   return &instance;
04955 #endif  // (_MSC_VER == 1310 && !defined(_DEBUG)) || defined(__BORLANDC__)
04956 }
04957 
04958 // Gets the number of successful test cases.
04959 int UnitTest::successful_test_case_count() const {
04960   return impl()->successful_test_case_count();
04961 }
04962 
04963 // Gets the number of failed test cases.
04964 int UnitTest::failed_test_case_count() const {
04965   return impl()->failed_test_case_count();
04966 }
04967 
04968 // Gets the number of all test cases.
04969 int UnitTest::total_test_case_count() const {
04970   return impl()->total_test_case_count();
04971 }
04972 
04973 // Gets the number of all test cases that contain at least one test
04974 // that should run.
04975 int UnitTest::test_case_to_run_count() const {
04976   return impl()->test_case_to_run_count();
04977 }
04978 
04979 // Gets the number of successful tests.
04980 int UnitTest::successful_test_count() const {
04981   return impl()->successful_test_count();
04982 }
04983 
04984 // Gets the number of failed tests.
04985 int UnitTest::failed_test_count() const { return impl()->failed_test_count(); }
04986 
04987 // Gets the number of disabled tests.
04988 int UnitTest::disabled_test_count() const {
04989   return impl()->disabled_test_count();
04990 }
04991 
04992 // Gets the number of all tests.
04993 int UnitTest::total_test_count() const { return impl()->total_test_count(); }
04994 
04995 // Gets the number of tests that should run.
04996 int UnitTest::test_to_run_count() const { return impl()->test_to_run_count(); }
04997 
04998 // Gets the elapsed time, in milliseconds.
04999 internal::TimeInMillis UnitTest::elapsed_time() const {
05000   return impl()->elapsed_time();
05001 }
05002 
05003 // Returns true iff the unit test passed (i.e. all test cases passed).
05004 bool UnitTest::Passed() const { return impl()->Passed(); }
05005 
05006 // Returns true iff the unit test failed (i.e. some test case failed
05007 // or something outside of all tests failed).
05008 bool UnitTest::Failed() const { return impl()->Failed(); }
05009 
05010 // Gets the i-th test case among all the test cases. i can range from 0 to
05011 // total_test_case_count() - 1. If i is not in that range, returns NULL.
05012 const TestCase* UnitTest::GetTestCase(int i) const {
05013   return impl()->GetTestCase(i);
05014 }
05015 
05016 // Gets the i-th test case among all the test cases. i can range from 0 to
05017 // total_test_case_count() - 1. If i is not in that range, returns NULL.
05018 TestCase* UnitTest::GetMutableTestCase(int i) {
05019   return impl()->GetMutableTestCase(i);
05020 }
05021 
05022 // Returns the list of event listeners that can be used to track events
05023 // inside Google Test.
05024 TestEventListeners& UnitTest::listeners() {
05025   return *impl()->listeners();
05026 }
05027 
05028 // Registers and returns a global test environment.  When a test
05029 // program is run, all global test environments will be set-up in the
05030 // order they were registered.  After all tests in the program have
05031 // finished, all global test environments will be torn-down in the
05032 // *reverse* order they were registered.
05033 //
05034 // The UnitTest object takes ownership of the given environment.
05035 //
05036 // We don't protect this under mutex_, as we only support calling it
05037 // from the main thread.
05038 Environment* UnitTest::AddEnvironment(Environment* env) {
05039   if (env == NULL) {
05040     return NULL;
05041   }
05042 
05043   impl_->environments().push_back(env);
05044   return env;
05045 }
05046 
05047 // Adds a TestPartResult to the current TestResult object.  All Google Test
05048 // assertion macros (e.g. ASSERT_TRUE, EXPECT_EQ, etc) eventually call
05049 // this to report their results.  The user code should use the
05050 // assertion macros instead of calling this directly.
05051 // L < mutex_
05052 void UnitTest::AddTestPartResult(TestPartResult::Type result_type,
05053                                  const char* file_name,
05054                                  int line_number,
05055                                  const internal::String& message,
05056                                  const internal::String& os_stack_trace) {
05057   Message msg;
05058   msg << message;
05059 
05060   internal::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
05061   if (impl_->gtest_trace_stack().size() > 0) {
05062     msg << "\n" << GTEST_NAME_ << " trace:";
05063 
05064     for (int i = static_cast<int>(impl_->gtest_trace_stack().size());
05065          i > 0; --i) {
05066       const internal::TraceInfo& trace = impl_->gtest_trace_stack()[i - 1];
05067       msg << "\n" << internal::FormatFileLocation(trace.file, trace.line)
05068           << " " << trace.message;
05069     }
05070   }
05071 
05072   if (os_stack_trace.c_str() != NULL && !os_stack_trace.empty()) {
05073     msg << internal::kStackTraceMarker << os_stack_trace;
05074   }
05075 
05076   const TestPartResult result =
05077     TestPartResult(result_type, file_name, line_number,
05078                    msg.GetString().c_str());
05079   impl_->GetTestPartResultReporterForCurrentThread()->
05080       ReportTestPartResult(result);
05081 
05082   if (result_type != TestPartResult::kSuccess) {
05083     // gtest_break_on_failure takes precedence over
05084     // gtest_throw_on_failure.  This allows a user to set the latter
05085     // in the code (perhaps in order to use Google Test assertions
05086     // with another testing framework) and specify the former on the
05087     // command line for debugging.
05088     if (GTEST_FLAG(break_on_failure)) {
05089 #if GTEST_OS_WINDOWS
05090       // Using DebugBreak on Windows allows gtest to still break into a debugger
05091       // when a failure happens and both the --gtest_break_on_failure and
05092       // the --gtest_catch_exceptions flags are specified.
05093       DebugBreak();
05094 #else
05095       // Dereference NULL through a volatile pointer to prevent the compiler
05096       // from removing. We use this rather than abort() or __builtin_trap() for
05097       // portability: Symbian doesn't implement abort() well, and some debuggers
05098       // don't correctly trap abort().
05099       *static_cast<volatile int*>(NULL) = 1;
05100 #endif  // GTEST_OS_WINDOWS
05101     } else if (GTEST_FLAG(throw_on_failure)) {
05102 #if GTEST_HAS_EXCEPTIONS
05103       throw GoogleTestFailureException(result);
05104 #else
05105       // We cannot call abort() as it generates a pop-up in debug mode
05106       // that cannot be suppressed in VC 7.1 or below.
05107       exit(1);
05108 #endif
05109     }
05110   }
05111 }
05112 
05113 // Creates and adds a property to the current TestResult. If a property matching
05114 // the supplied value already exists, updates its value instead.
05115 void UnitTest::RecordPropertyForCurrentTest(const char* key,
05116                                             const char* value) {
05117   const TestProperty test_property(key, value);
05118   impl_->current_test_result()->RecordProperty(test_property);
05119 }
05120 
05121 // Runs all tests in this UnitTest object and prints the result.
05122 // Returns 0 if successful, or 1 otherwise.
05123 //
05124 // We don't protect this under mutex_, as we only support calling it
05125 // from the main thread.
05126 int UnitTest::Run() {
05127   // Captures the value of GTEST_FLAG(catch_exceptions).  This value will be
05128   // used for the duration of the program.
05129   impl()->set_catch_exceptions(GTEST_FLAG(catch_exceptions));
05130 
05131 #if GTEST_HAS_SEH
05132   const bool in_death_test_child_process =
05133       internal::GTEST_FLAG(internal_run_death_test).length() > 0;
05134 
05135   // Either the user wants Google Test to catch exceptions thrown by the
05136   // tests or this is executing in the context of death test child
05137   // process. In either case the user does not want to see pop-up dialogs
05138   // about crashes - they are expected.
05139   if (impl()->catch_exceptions() || in_death_test_child_process) {
05140 
05141 # if !GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE
05142     // SetErrorMode doesn't exist on CE.
05143     SetErrorMode(SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS | SEM_NOALIGNMENTFAULTEXCEPT |
05144                  SEM_NOGPFAULTERRORBOX | SEM_NOOPENFILEERRORBOX);
05145 # endif  // !GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE
05146 
05147 # if (defined(_MSC_VER) || GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MINGW) && !GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE
05148     // Death test children can be terminated with _abort().  On Windows,
05149     // _abort() can show a dialog with a warning message.  This forces the
05150     // abort message to go to stderr instead.
05151     _set_error_mode(_OUT_TO_STDERR);
05152 # endif
05153 
05154 # if _MSC_VER >= 1400 && !GTEST_OS_WINDOWS_MOBILE
05155     // In the debug version, Visual Studio pops up a separate dialog
05156     // offering a choice to debug the aborted program. We need to suppress
05157     // this dialog or it will pop up for every EXPECT/ASSERT_DEATH statement
05158     // executed. Google Test will notify the user of any unexpected
05159     // failure via stderr.
05160     //
05161     // VC++ doesn't define _set_abort_behavior() prior to the version 8.0.
05162     // Users of prior VC versions shall suffer the agony and pain of
05163     // clicking through the countless debug dialogs.
05164     // TODO(vladl@google.com): find a way to suppress the abort dialog() in the
05165     // debug mode when compiled with VC 7.1 or lower.
05166     if (!GTEST_FLAG(break_on_failure))
05167       _set_abort_behavior(
05168           0x0,                                    // Clear the following flags:
05169           _WRITE_ABORT_MSG | _CALL_REPORTFAULT);  // pop-up window, core dump.
05170 # endif
05171 
05172   }
05173 #endif  // GTEST_HAS_SEH
05174 
05175   return internal::HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported(
05176       impl(),
05177       &internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests,
05178       "auxiliary test code (environments or event listeners)") ? 0 : 1;
05179 }
05180 
05181 // Returns the working directory when the first TEST() or TEST_F() was
05182 // executed.
05183 const char* UnitTest::original_working_dir() const {
05184   return impl_->original_working_dir_.c_str();
05185 }
05186 
05187 // Returns the TestCase object for the test that's currently running,
05188 // or NULL if no test is running.
05189 // L < mutex_
05190 const TestCase* UnitTest::current_test_case() const {
05191   internal::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
05192   return impl_->current_test_case();
05193 }
05194 
05195 // Returns the TestInfo object for the test that's currently running,
05196 // or NULL if no test is running.
05197 // L < mutex_
05198 const TestInfo* UnitTest::current_test_info() const {
05199   internal::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
05200   return impl_->current_test_info();
05201 }
05202 
05203 // Returns the random seed used at the start of the current test run.
05204 int UnitTest::random_seed() const { return impl_->random_seed(); }
05205 
05206 #if GTEST_HAS_PARAM_TEST
05207 // Returns ParameterizedTestCaseRegistry object used to keep track of
05208 // value-parameterized tests and instantiate and register them.
05209 // L < mutex_
05210 internal::ParameterizedTestCaseRegistry&
05211     UnitTest::parameterized_test_registry() {
05212   return impl_->parameterized_test_registry();
05213 }
05214 #endif  // GTEST_HAS_PARAM_TEST
05215 
05216 // Creates an empty UnitTest.
05217 UnitTest::UnitTest() {
05218   impl_ = new internal::UnitTestImpl(this);
05219 }
05220 
05221 // Destructor of UnitTest.
05222 UnitTest::~UnitTest() {
05223   delete impl_;
05224 }
05225 
05226 // Pushes a trace defined by SCOPED_TRACE() on to the per-thread
05227 // Google Test trace stack.
05228 // L < mutex_
05229 void UnitTest::PushGTestTrace(const internal::TraceInfo& trace) {
05230   internal::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
05231   impl_->gtest_trace_stack().push_back(trace);
05232 }
05233 
05234 // Pops a trace from the per-thread Google Test trace stack.
05235 // L < mutex_
05236 void UnitTest::PopGTestTrace() {
05237   internal::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
05238   impl_->gtest_trace_stack().pop_back();
05239 }
05240 
05241 namespace internal {
05242 
05243 UnitTestImpl::UnitTestImpl(UnitTest* parent)
05244     : parent_(parent),
05245 #ifdef _MSC_VER
05246 # pragma warning(push)                    // Saves the current warning state.
05247 # pragma warning(disable:4355)            // Temporarily disables warning 4355
05248                                          // (using this in initializer).
05249       default_global_test_part_result_reporter_(this),
05250       default_per_thread_test_part_result_reporter_(this),
05251 # pragma warning(pop)                     // Restores the warning state again.
05252 #else
05253       default_global_test_part_result_reporter_(this),
05254       default_per_thread_test_part_result_reporter_(this),
05255 #endif  // _MSC_VER
05256       global_test_part_result_repoter_(
05257           &default_global_test_part_result_reporter_),
05258       per_thread_test_part_result_reporter_(
05259           &default_per_thread_test_part_result_reporter_),
05260 #if GTEST_HAS_PARAM_TEST
05261       parameterized_test_registry_(),
05262       parameterized_tests_registered_(false),
05263 #endif  // GTEST_HAS_PARAM_TEST
05264       last_death_test_case_(-1),
05265       current_test_case_(NULL),
05266       current_test_info_(NULL),
05267       ad_hoc_test_result_(),
05268       os_stack_trace_getter_(NULL),
05269       post_flag_parse_init_performed_(false),
05270       random_seed_(0),  // Will be overridden by the flag before first use.
05271       random_(0),  // Will be reseeded before first use.
05272       elapsed_time_(0),
05273 #if GTEST_HAS_DEATH_TEST
05274       internal_run_death_test_flag_(NULL),
05275       death_test_factory_(new DefaultDeathTestFactory),
05276 #endif
05277       // Will be overridden by the flag before first use.
05278       catch_exceptions_(false) {
05279   listeners()->SetDefaultResultPrinter(new PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter);
05280 }
05281 
05282 UnitTestImpl::~UnitTestImpl() {
05283   // Deletes every TestCase.
05284   ForEach(test_cases_, internal::Delete<TestCase>);
05285 
05286   // Deletes every Environment.
05287   ForEach(environments_, internal::Delete<Environment>);
05288 
05289   delete os_stack_trace_getter_;
05290 }
05291 
05292 #if GTEST_HAS_DEATH_TEST
05293 // Disables event forwarding if the control is currently in a death test
05294 // subprocess. Must not be called before InitGoogleTest.
05295 void UnitTestImpl::SuppressTestEventsIfInSubprocess() {
05296   if (internal_run_death_test_flag_.get() != NULL)
05297     listeners()->SuppressEventForwarding();
05298 }
05299 #endif  // GTEST_HAS_DEATH_TEST
05300 
05301 // Initializes event listeners performing XML output as specified by
05302 // UnitTestOptions. Must not be called before InitGoogleTest.
05303 void UnitTestImpl::ConfigureXmlOutput() {
05304   const String& output_format = UnitTestOptions::GetOutputFormat();
05305   if (output_format == "xml") {
05306     listeners()->SetDefaultXmlGenerator(new XmlUnitTestResultPrinter(
05307         UnitTestOptions::GetAbsolutePathToOutputFile().c_str()));
05308   } else if (output_format != "") {
05309     printf("WARNING: unrecognized output format \"%s\" ignored.\n",
05310            output_format.c_str());
05311     fflush(stdout);
05312   }
05313 }
05314 
05315 #if GTEST_CAN_STREAM_RESULTS_
05316 // Initializes event listeners for streaming test results in String form.
05317 // Must not be called before InitGoogleTest.
05318 void UnitTestImpl::ConfigureStreamingOutput() {
05319   const string& target = GTEST_FLAG(stream_result_to);
05320   if (!target.empty()) {
05321     const size_t pos = target.find(':');
05322     if (pos != string::npos) {
05323       listeners()->Append(new StreamingListener(target.substr(0, pos),
05324                                                 target.substr(pos+1)));
05325     } else {
05326       printf("WARNING: unrecognized streaming target \"%s\" ignored.\n",
05327              target.c_str());
05328       fflush(stdout);
05329     }
05330   }
05331 }
05332 #endif  // GTEST_CAN_STREAM_RESULTS_
05333 
05334 // Performs initialization dependent upon flag values obtained in
05335 // ParseGoogleTestFlagsOnly.  Is called from InitGoogleTest after the call to
05336 // ParseGoogleTestFlagsOnly.  In case a user neglects to call InitGoogleTest
05337 // this function is also called from RunAllTests.  Since this function can be
05338 // called more than once, it has to be idempotent.
05339 void UnitTestImpl::PostFlagParsingInit() {
05340   // Ensures that this function does not execute more than once.
05341   if (!post_flag_parse_init_performed_) {
05342     post_flag_parse_init_performed_ = true;
05343 
05344 #if GTEST_HAS_DEATH_TEST
05345     InitDeathTestSubprocessControlInfo();
05346     SuppressTestEventsIfInSubprocess();
05347 #endif  // GTEST_HAS_DEATH_TEST
05348 
05349     // Registers parameterized tests. This makes parameterized tests
05350     // available to the UnitTest reflection API without running
05351     // RUN_ALL_TESTS.
05352     RegisterParameterizedTests();
05353 
05354     // Configures listeners for XML output. This makes it possible for users
05355     // to shut down the default XML output before invoking RUN_ALL_TESTS.
05356     ConfigureXmlOutput();
05357 
05358 #if GTEST_CAN_STREAM_RESULTS_
05359     // Configures listeners for streaming test results to the specified server.
05360     ConfigureStreamingOutput();
05361 #endif  // GTEST_CAN_STREAM_RESULTS_
05362   }
05363 }
05364 
05365 // A predicate that checks the name of a TestCase against a known
05366 // value.
05367 //
05368 // This is used for implementation of the UnitTest class only.  We put
05369 // it in the anonymous namespace to prevent polluting the outer
05370 // namespace.
05371 //
05372 // TestCaseNameIs is copyable.
05373 class TestCaseNameIs {
05374  public:
05375   // Constructor.
05376   explicit TestCaseNameIs(const String& name)
05377       : name_(name) {}
05378 
05379   // Returns true iff the name of test_case matches name_.
05380   bool operator()(const TestCase* test_case) const {
05381     return test_case != NULL && strcmp(test_case->name(), name_.c_str()) == 0;
05382   }
05383 
05384  private:
05385   String name_;
05386 };
05387 
05388 // Finds and returns a TestCase with the given name.  If one doesn't
05389 // exist, creates one and returns it.  It's the CALLER'S
05390 // RESPONSIBILITY to ensure that this function is only called WHEN THE
05391 // TESTS ARE NOT SHUFFLED.
05392 //
05393 // Arguments:
05394 //
05395 //   test_case_name: name of the test case
05396 //   type_param:     the name of the test case's type parameter, or NULL if
05397 //                   this is not a typed or a type-parameterized test case.
05398 //   set_up_tc:      pointer to the function that sets up the test case
05399 //   tear_down_tc:   pointer to the function that tears down the test case
05400 TestCase* UnitTestImpl::GetTestCase(const char* test_case_name,
05401                                     const char* type_param,
05402                                     Test::SetUpTestCaseFunc set_up_tc,
05403                                     Test::TearDownTestCaseFunc tear_down_tc) {
05404   // Can we find a TestCase with the given name?
05405   const std::vector<TestCase*>::const_iterator test_case =
05406       std::find_if(test_cases_.begin(), test_cases_.end(),
05407                    TestCaseNameIs(test_case_name));
05408 
05409   if (test_case != test_cases_.end())
05410     return *test_case;
05411 
05412   // No.  Let's create one.
05413   TestCase* const new_test_case =
05414       new TestCase(test_case_name, type_param, set_up_tc, tear_down_tc);
05415 
05416   // Is this a death test case?
05417   if (internal::UnitTestOptions::MatchesFilter(String(test_case_name),
05418                                                kDeathTestCaseFilter)) {
05419     // Yes.  Inserts the test case after the last death test case
05420     // defined so far.  This only works when the test cases haven't
05421     // been shuffled.  Otherwise we may end up running a death test
05422     // after a non-death test.
05423     ++last_death_test_case_;
05424     test_cases_.insert(test_cases_.begin() + last_death_test_case_,
05425                        new_test_case);
05426   } else {
05427     // No.  Appends to the end of the list.
05428     test_cases_.push_back(new_test_case);
05429   }
05430 
05431   test_case_indices_.push_back(static_cast<int>(test_case_indices_.size()));
05432   return new_test_case;
05433 }
05434 
05435 // Helpers for setting up / tearing down the given environment.  They
05436 // are for use in the ForEach() function.
05437 static void SetUpEnvironment(Environment* env) { env->SetUp(); }
05438 static void TearDownEnvironment(Environment* env) { env->TearDown(); }
05439 
05440 // Runs all tests in this UnitTest object, prints the result, and
05441 // returns true if all tests are successful.  If any exception is
05442 // thrown during a test, the test is considered to be failed, but the
05443 // rest of the tests will still be run.
05444 //
05445 // When parameterized tests are enabled, it expands and registers
05446 // parameterized tests first in RegisterParameterizedTests().
05447 // All other functions called from RunAllTests() may safely assume that
05448 // parameterized tests are ready to be counted and run.
05449 bool UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() {
05450   // Makes sure InitGoogleTest() was called.
05451   if (!GTestIsInitialized()) {
05452     printf("%s",
05453            "\nThis test program did NOT call ::testing::InitGoogleTest "
05454            "before calling RUN_ALL_TESTS().  Please fix it.\n");
05455     return false;
05456   }
05457 
05458   // Do not run any test if the --help flag was specified.
05459   if (g_help_flag)
05460     return true;
05461 
05462   // Repeats the call to the post-flag parsing initialization in case the
05463   // user didn't call InitGoogleTest.
05464   PostFlagParsingInit();
05465 
05466   // Even if sharding is not on, test runners may want to use the
05467   // GTEST_SHARD_STATUS_FILE to query whether the test supports the sharding
05468   // protocol.
05469   internal::WriteToShardStatusFileIfNeeded();
05470 
05471   // True iff we are in a subprocess for running a thread-safe-style
05472   // death test.
05473   bool in_subprocess_for_death_test = false;
05474 
05475 #if GTEST_HAS_DEATH_TEST
05476   in_subprocess_for_death_test = (internal_run_death_test_flag_.get() != NULL);
05477 #endif  // GTEST_HAS_DEATH_TEST
05478 
05479   const bool should_shard = ShouldShard(kTestTotalShards, kTestShardIndex,
05480                                         in_subprocess_for_death_test);
05481 
05482   // Compares the full test names with the filter to decide which
05483   // tests to run.
05484   const bool has_tests_to_run = FilterTests(should_shard
05485                                               ? HONOR_SHARDING_PROTOCOL
05486                                               : IGNORE_SHARDING_PROTOCOL) > 0;
05487 
05488   // Lists the tests and exits if the --gtest_list_tests flag was specified.
05489   if (GTEST_FLAG(list_tests)) {
05490     // This must be called *after* FilterTests() has been called.
05491     ListTestsMatchingFilter();
05492     return true;
05493   }
05494 
05495   random_seed_ = GTEST_FLAG(shuffle) ?
05496       GetRandomSeedFromFlag(GTEST_FLAG(random_seed)) : 0;
05497 
05498   // True iff at least one test has failed.
05499   bool failed = false;
05500 
05501   TestEventListener* repeater = listeners()->repeater();
05502 
05503   repeater->OnTestProgramStart(*parent_);
05504 
05505   // How many times to repeat the tests?  We don't want to repeat them
05506   // when we are inside the subprocess of a death test.
05507   const int repeat = in_subprocess_for_death_test ? 1 : GTEST_FLAG(repeat);
05508   // Repeats forever if the repeat count is negative.
05509   const bool forever = repeat < 0;
05510   for (int i = 0; forever || i != repeat; i++) {
05511     // We want to preserve failures generated by ad-hoc test
05512     // assertions executed before RUN_ALL_TESTS().
05513     ClearNonAdHocTestResult();
05514 
05515     const TimeInMillis start = GetTimeInMillis();
05516 
05517     // Shuffles test cases and tests if requested.
05518     if (has_tests_to_run && GTEST_FLAG(shuffle)) {
05519       random()->Reseed(random_seed_);
05520       // This should be done before calling OnTestIterationStart(),
05521       // such that a test event listener can see the actual test order
05522       // in the event.
05523       ShuffleTests();
05524     }
05525 
05526     // Tells the unit test event listeners that the tests are about to start.
05527     repeater->OnTestIterationStart(*parent_, i);
05528 
05529     // Runs each test case if there is at least one test to run.
05530     if (has_tests_to_run) {
05531       // Sets up all environments beforehand.
05532       repeater->OnEnvironmentsSetUpStart(*parent_);
05533       ForEach(environments_, SetUpEnvironment);
05534       repeater->OnEnvironmentsSetUpEnd(*parent_);
05535 
05536       // Runs the tests only if there was no fatal failure during global
05537       // set-up.
05538       if (!Test::HasFatalFailure()) {
05539         for (int test_index = 0; test_index < total_test_case_count();
05540              test_index++) {
05541           GetMutableTestCase(test_index)->Run();
05542         }
05543       }
05544 
05545       // Tears down all environments in reverse order afterwards.
05546       repeater->OnEnvironmentsTearDownStart(*parent_);
05547       std::for_each(environments_.rbegin(), environments_.rend(),
05548                     TearDownEnvironment);
05549       repeater->OnEnvironmentsTearDownEnd(*parent_);
05550     }
05551 
05552     elapsed_time_ = GetTimeInMillis() - start;
05553 
05554     // Tells the unit test event listener that the tests have just finished.
05555     repeater->OnTestIterationEnd(*parent_, i);
05556 
05557     // Gets the result and clears it.
05558     if (!Passed()) {
05559       failed = true;
05560     }
05561 
05562     // Restores the original test order after the iteration.  This
05563     // allows the user to quickly repro a failure that happens in the
05564     // N-th iteration without repeating the first (N - 1) iterations.
05565     // This is not enclosed in "if (GTEST_FLAG(shuffle)) { ... }", in
05566     // case the user somehow changes the value of the flag somewhere
05567     // (it's always safe to unshuffle the tests).
05568     UnshuffleTests();
05569 
05570     if (GTEST_FLAG(shuffle)) {
05571       // Picks a new random seed for each iteration.
05572       random_seed_ = GetNextRandomSeed(random_seed_);
05573     }
05574   }
05575 
05576   repeater->OnTestProgramEnd(*parent_);
05577 
05578   return !failed;
05579 }
05580 
05581 // Reads the GTEST_SHARD_STATUS_FILE environment variable, and creates the file
05582 // if the variable is present. If a file already exists at this location, this
05583 // function will write over it. If the variable is present, but the file cannot
05584 // be created, prints an error and exits.
05585 void WriteToShardStatusFileIfNeeded() {
05586   const char* const test_shard_file = posix::GetEnv(kTestShardStatusFile);
05587   if (test_shard_file != NULL) {
05588     FILE* const file = posix::FOpen(test_shard_file, "w");
05589     if (file == NULL) {
05590       ColoredPrintf(COLOR_RED,
05591                     "Could not write to the test shard status file \"%s\" "
05592                     "specified by the %s environment variable.\n",
05593                     test_shard_file, kTestShardStatusFile);
05594       fflush(stdout);
05595       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
05596     }
05597     fclose(file);
05598   }
05599 }
05600 
05601 // Checks whether sharding is enabled by examining the relevant
05602 // environment variable values. If the variables are present,
05603 // but inconsistent (i.e., shard_index >= total_shards), prints
05604 // an error and exits. If in_subprocess_for_death_test, sharding is
05605 // disabled because it must only be applied to the original test
05606 // process. Otherwise, we could filter out death tests we intended to execute.
05607 bool ShouldShard(const char* total_shards_env,
05608                  const char* shard_index_env,
05609                  bool in_subprocess_for_death_test) {
05610   if (in_subprocess_for_death_test) {
05611     return false;
05612   }
05613 
05614   const Int32 total_shards = Int32FromEnvOrDie(total_shards_env, -1);
05615   const Int32 shard_index = Int32FromEnvOrDie(shard_index_env, -1);
05616 
05617   if (total_shards == -1 && shard_index == -1) {
05618     return false;
05619   } else if (total_shards == -1 && shard_index != -1) {
05620     const Message msg = Message()
05621       << "Invalid environment variables: you have "
05622       << kTestShardIndex << " = " << shard_index
05623       << ", but have left " << kTestTotalShards << " unset.\n";
05624     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_RED, msg.GetString().c_str());
05625     fflush(stdout);
05626     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
05627   } else if (total_shards != -1 && shard_index == -1) {
05628     const Message msg = Message()
05629       << "Invalid environment variables: you have "
05630       << kTestTotalShards << " = " << total_shards
05631       << ", but have left " << kTestShardIndex << " unset.\n";
05632     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_RED, msg.GetString().c_str());
05633     fflush(stdout);
05634     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
05635   } else if (shard_index < 0 || shard_index >= total_shards) {
05636     const Message msg = Message()
05637       << "Invalid environment variables: we require 0 <= "
05638       << kTestShardIndex << " < " << kTestTotalShards
05639       << ", but you have " << kTestShardIndex << "=" << shard_index
05640       << ", " << kTestTotalShards << "=" << total_shards << ".\n";
05641     ColoredPrintf(COLOR_RED, msg.GetString().c_str());
05642     fflush(stdout);
05643     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
05644   }
05645 
05646   return total_shards > 1;
05647 }
05648 
05649 // Parses the environment variable var as an Int32. If it is unset,
05650 // returns default_val. If it is not an Int32, prints an error
05651 // and aborts.
05652 Int32 Int32FromEnvOrDie(const char* var, Int32 default_val) {
05653   const char* str_val = posix::GetEnv(var);
05654   if (str_val == NULL) {
05655     return default_val;
05656   }
05657 
05658   Int32 result;
05659   if (!ParseInt32(Message() << "The value of environment variable " << var,
05660                   str_val, &result)) {
05661     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
05662   }
05663   return result;
05664 }
05665 
05666 // Given the total number of shards, the shard index, and the test id,
05667 // returns true iff the test should be run on this shard. The test id is
05668 // some arbitrary but unique non-negative integer assigned to each test
05669 // method. Assumes that 0 <= shard_index < total_shards.
05670 bool ShouldRunTestOnShard(int total_shards, int shard_index, int test_id) {
05671   return (test_id % total_shards) == shard_index;
05672 }
05673 
05674 // Compares the name of each test with the user-specified filter to
05675 // decide whether the test should be run, then records the result in
05676 // each TestCase and TestInfo object.
05677 // If shard_tests == true, further filters tests based on sharding
05678 // variables in the environment - see
05679 // http://code.google.com/p/googletest/wiki/GoogleTestAdvancedGuide.
05680 // Returns the number of tests that should run.
05681 int UnitTestImpl::FilterTests(ReactionToSharding shard_tests) {
05682   const Int32 total_shards = shard_tests == HONOR_SHARDING_PROTOCOL ?
05683       Int32FromEnvOrDie(kTestTotalShards, -1) : -1;
05684   const Int32 shard_index = shard_tests == HONOR_SHARDING_PROTOCOL ?
05685       Int32FromEnvOrDie(kTestShardIndex, -1) : -1;
05686 
05687   // num_runnable_tests are the number of tests that will
05688   // run across all shards (i.e., match filter and are not disabled).
05689   // num_selected_tests are the number of tests to be run on
05690   // this shard.
05691   int num_runnable_tests = 0;
05692   int num_selected_tests = 0;
05693   for (size_t i = 0; i < test_cases_.size(); i++) {
05694     TestCase* const test_case = test_cases_[i];
05695     const String &test_case_name = test_case->name();
05696     test_case->set_should_run(false);
05697 
05698     for (size_t j = 0; j < test_case->test_info_list().size(); j++) {
05699       TestInfo* const test_info = test_case->test_info_list()[j];
05700       const String test_name(test_info->name());
05701       // A test is disabled if test case name or test name matches
05702       // kDisableTestFilter.
05703       const bool is_disabled =
05704           internal::UnitTestOptions::MatchesFilter(test_case_name,
05705                                                    kDisableTestFilter) ||
05706           internal::UnitTestOptions::MatchesFilter(test_name,
05707                                                    kDisableTestFilter);
05708       test_info->is_disabled_ = is_disabled;
05709 
05710       const bool matches_filter =
05711           internal::UnitTestOptions::FilterMatchesTest(test_case_name,
05712                                                        test_name);
05713       test_info->matches_filter_ = matches_filter;
05714 
05715       const bool is_runnable =
05716           (GTEST_FLAG(also_run_disabled_tests) || !is_disabled) &&
05717           matches_filter;
05718 
05719       const bool is_selected = is_runnable &&
05720           (shard_tests == IGNORE_SHARDING_PROTOCOL ||
05721            ShouldRunTestOnShard(total_shards, shard_index,
05722                                 num_runnable_tests));
05723 
05724       num_runnable_tests += is_runnable;
05725       num_selected_tests += is_selected;
05726 
05727       test_info->should_run_ = is_selected;
05728       test_case->set_should_run(test_case->should_run() || is_selected);
05729     }
05730   }
05731   return num_selected_tests;
05732 }
05733 
05734 // Prints the names of the tests matching the user-specified filter flag.
05735 void UnitTestImpl::ListTestsMatchingFilter() {
05736   for (size_t i = 0; i < test_cases_.size(); i++) {
05737     const TestCase* const test_case = test_cases_[i];
05738     bool printed_test_case_name = false;
05739 
05740     for (size_t j = 0; j < test_case->test_info_list().size(); j++) {
05741       const TestInfo* const test_info =
05742           test_case->test_info_list()[j];
05743       if (test_info->matches_filter_) {
05744         if (!printed_test_case_name) {
05745           printed_test_case_name = true;
05746           printf("%s.\n", test_case->name());
05747         }
05748         printf("  %s\n", test_info->name());
05749       }
05750     }
05751   }
05752   fflush(stdout);
05753 }
05754 
05755 // Sets the OS stack trace getter.
05756 //
05757 // Does nothing if the input and the current OS stack trace getter are
05758 // the same; otherwise, deletes the old getter and makes the input the
05759 // current getter.
05760 void UnitTestImpl::set_os_stack_trace_getter(
05761     OsStackTraceGetterInterface* getter) {
05762   if (os_stack_trace_getter_ != getter) {
05763     delete os_stack_trace_getter_;
05764     os_stack_trace_getter_ = getter;
05765   }
05766 }
05767 
05768 // Returns the current OS stack trace getter if it is not NULL;
05769 // otherwise, creates an OsStackTraceGetter, makes it the current
05770 // getter, and returns it.
